1.description: The seed on its back is filled with nutrients. The seed grows steadily larger as its body grows.

2.description: Exposure to sun­ light adds to its strength. Sunlight also makes the bud on its back grow larger.

3.description: By spreading the broad petals of its flower and catching the sun's rays, it fills its body with power.

4.description: The flame on its tail shows the strength of its life force. If it is weak, the flame also burns weakly.

5.description: It is very hot­ headed by nature, so it constantly seeks opponents. It calms down only when it wins.

6.description: If CHARIZARD be­ comes furious, the flame at the tip of its tail flares up in a whitish- blue color.

7.description: The shell is soft when it is born. It soon becomes so resilient, prod­ ding fingers will bounce off it.

8.description: It is recognized as a symbol of longevity. If its shell has algae on it, that WARTORTLE is very old.

9.description: It deliberately makes itself heavy so it can with­ stand the recoil of the water jets it fires.

10.description: For protection, it releases a horri­ ble stench from the antenna on its head to drive away enemies.

11.description: Inside the shell, it is soft and weak as it pre­ pares to evolve. It stays motion­ less in the shell.

12.description: It collects honey every day. It rubs honey onto the hairs on its legs to carry it back to its nest.

13.description: Its poison stinger is very powerful. Its bright-colored body is intended to warn off its enemies.

14.description: Although it is a cocoon, it can move a little. It can extend its poison barb if it is attacked.

15.description: It can take down any opponent with its powerful poi­ son stingers. It sometimes attacks in swarms.

16.description: It usually hides in tall grass. Be­ cause it dislikes fighting, it pro­ tects itself by kicking up sand.

17.description: It has outstanding vision. However high it flies, it is able to distin­ guish the move­ ments of its prey.

18.description: Its well-developed chest muscles make it strong enough to whip up a gusty windstorm with just a few flaps.

19.description: It eats anything. Wherever food is available, it will settle down and produce offspring continuously.

20.description: Gnaws on anything with its tough fangs. It can even topple concrete buildings by gnaw­ ing on them.

21.description: It flaps its short wings to flush out insects from tall grass. It then plucks them with its stubby beak.

22.description: It shoots itself suddenly high into the sky, then plummets down in one fell swoop to strike its prey.

23.description: It can freely de­ tach its jaw to swallow large prey whole. It can be­ come too heavy to move, however.

24.description: Transfixing prey with the face-like pattern on its belly, it binds and poisons the frightened victim.

25.description: This intelligent POKéMON roasts hard BERRIES with electricity to make them tender enough to eat.

26.description: When its electric­ ity builds, its muscles are stimu­ lated, and it be­ comes more aggres­ sive than usual.

27.description: If it fell from a great height, this POKéMON could save itself by rolling into a ball and bouncing.

28.description: In an attempt to hide itself, it will run around at top speed to kick up a blinding dust storm.

29.description: The poison hidden in its small horn is extremely po­ tent. Even a tiny scratch can have fatal results.

30.description: When feeding its young, it first chews and tender­ izes the food, then spits it out for the offspring.

31.description: Its body is cover­ ed with needle- like scales. It never shows signs of shrinking from any attack.

32.description: It is small, but its horn is filled with poison. It charges then stabs with the horn to inject poison.

33.description: It raises its big ears to check its surroundings. If it senses any­ thing, it attacks immediately.

34.description: It swings its big tail around during battle. If its foe flinches, it will charge with its sturdy body.

35.description: The moonlight that it stores in the wings on its back apparently gives it the ability to float in midair.

36.description: With its acute hearing, it can pick up sounds from far away. It usually hides in quiet places.

37.description: As it develops,  its single white tail gains color and splits into six. It is quite warm and cuddly.

38.description: Some legends claim that each of its nine tails has its own unique type of special mystical power.

39.description: If it inflates to SING a lullaby, it can perform longer and cause sure drowsiness in its audience.

40.description: Their fur feels so good that if two of them snuggle together, they won't want to be separated.

41.description: While flying, it constantly emits ultrasonic waves from its mouth to check its sur­ roundings.

42.description: However hard its victim's hide may be, it punctures with sharp fangs and gorges itself with blood.

43.description: Awakened by moon­ light, it roams  actively at night. In the day, it stays quietly underground.

44.description: What appears to be drool is actually sweet honey. It is very sticky and clings stubbornly if touched.

45.description: It has the world's largest petals. With every step, the petals shake out heavy clouds of toxic pollen.

46.description: It is doused with mushroom spores when it is born. As its body grows, mushrooms sprout from its back.

47.description: It stays mostly in dark, damp places, the preference not of the bug, but of the big mush­ rooms on its back.

48.description: Its eyes also function as radar units. It catches and eats small bugs that hide in darkness.

49.description: When it attacks, it flaps its large wings violently to scatter its poi­ sonous powder all around.

50.description: Its skin is very thin. If it is exposed to light, its blood heats up, causing it to grow weak.

51.description: Its three heads bob separately up and down to loosen the soil nearby, making it easier for it to burrow.

52.description: It is fascinated by round objects. It can't stop playing with them until it tires and falls asleep.

53.description: Many adore it for its sophisticated air. However, it will lash out and scratch for little reason.

54.description: It has mystical powers but doesn't recall that it has used them. That is why it always looks puzzled.

55.description: When it swims at full speed using its long, webbed limbs, its fore­ head somehow be­ gins to glow.

56.description: It is extremely ill-tempered. Groups of them will attack any handy target for no reason.

57.description: If approached while asleep, it may awaken and angrily give chase in a groggy state of semi-sleep.

58.description: It has a brave and trustworthy na­ ture. It fear­ lessly stands up to bigger and stronger foes.

59.description: This legendary Chinese POKEMON is considered magnif­ icent. Many people are enchanted by its grand mane.

60.description: Because it is in­ ept at walking on its newly grown legs, it always  swims around in water.

61.description: The swirl on its belly subtly un­ dulates. Staring at it may gradual­ ly cause drowsi­ ness.

62.description: This strong and skilled swimmer is even capable of crossing the Pacific Ocean just by kicking.

63.description: It senses impend­ ing attacks and TELEPORTS away to safety before the actual attacks can strike.

64.description: It possesses strong spiritual power. The more danger it faces, the stronger its psychic power.

65.description: Closing both its eyes heightens all its other senses. This enables it to use its abilities to their extremes.

66.description: Always brimming with power, it passes time by lifting boulders. Doing so makes it even stronger.

67.description: It always goes at its full power, but this very tough and durable POKéMON never gets tired.

68.description: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.

69.description: Even though its body is extremely skinny, it is blindingly fast when catching its prey.

70.description: Even though it is filled with ACID, it does not melt because it also oozes a neutral­ izing fluid.

71.description: ACID that has dis­ solved many prey becomes sweeter, making it even more effective at attracting prey.

72.description: When the tide goes out, dehydrated TENTACOOL remains can be found washed up on the shore.

73.description: Its 80 tentacles absorb water and stretch almost endlessly to CON­ STRICT its prey and enemies.

74.description: Most people may not notice, but a closer look should reveal that there are many GEODUDE around.

75.description: With a free and uncaring nature, it doesn't mind if pieces break off while it rolls down mountains.

76.description: It sheds its skin once a year. The discarded shell immediately hard­ ens and crumbles away.

77.description: It is a weak run­ ner immediately after birth. It gradually becomes faster by chasing after its parents.

78.description: At full gallop, its four hooves barely touch the ground because it moves so incredi­ bly fast.

79.description: It lazes vacantly near water. If something bites its tail, it won't even notice for a whole day.

80.description: If the tail-biting SHELLDER is thrown off in a harsh battle, it reverts to being an ordi­ nary SLOWPOKE.

81.description: It is attracted by electromagnetic waves. It may approach trainers if they are using their POKéGEAR.

82.description: Three MAGNEMITE are linked by a strong magnetic force. Earaches will occur if you get too close.

83.description: If anyone tries to disturb where the essential plant sticks grow, it uses its own stick to thwart them.

84.description: By alternately raising and lower­ ing its two heads, it balances itself to be more stable while running.

85.description: It collects data  and plans three times as wisely, but it may think too much and be­ come immobilized.

86.description: Although it can't walk well on land, it is a graceful swimmer. It espe­ cially loves being in frigid seas.

87.description: Its streamlined body has little drag in water. The colder the temperature, the friskier it gets.

88.description: As it moves, it loses bits of its body from which new GRIMER emerge. This worsens the stench around it.

89.description: They love to gath­ er in smelly areas where sludge ac­ cumulates, making the stench around them worse.

90.description: It swims facing backward by open­ ing and closing its two-piece shell. It is surprisingly fast.

91.description: Once it slams its shell shut, it is impossible to open, even by those with superi­ or strength.

92.description: With its gas-like body, it can sneak into any place it desires. However, it can be blown away by wind.

93.description: In total darkness, where nothing is visible, HAUNTER lurks, silently stalking its next victim.

94.description: It steals heat from its surround­ ings. If you feel a sudden chill, it is certain that a GENGAR appeared.

95.description: It twists and squirms through the ground. The thunderous roar of its tunneling echoes a long way.

96.description: If you think that you had a good dream, but you can't remember it, a DROWZEE has probably eaten it.

97.description: When it is very hungry, it puts humans it meets to sleep, then it feasts on their dreams.

98.description: If it senses dan­ ger approaching, it cloaks itself with bubbles from its mouth so it will look bigger.

99.description: It can hardly lift its massive, overgrown pincer. The pincer's size makes it difficult to aim properly.

100.description: It rolls to move. If the ground is uneven, a sudden jolt from hitting a bump can cause it to explode.

101.description: It is dangerous. If it has too much electricity and has nothing to do, it amuses itself by exploding.

102.description: The shell is very durable. Even if it cracks, it can survive without spilling the contents.

103.description: Its three heads think independent­ ly. However, they are friendly and never appear to squabble.

104.description: If it is sad or lonely, the skull it wears shakes, and emits a plain­ tive and mournful sound.

105.description: It has been seen pounding boulders with the bone it carries in order to tap out mes­ sages to others.

106.description: This amazing POKé­ MON has an awesome sense of balance. It can kick in succession from any position.

107.description: Its punches slice the air. However, it seems to need a short break after fighting for three minutes.

108.description: Its tongue has well-developed nerves that run to the very tip, so it can be deft­ ly manipulated.

109.description: Its thin, filmy body is filled with gases that cause constant sniffles, coughs and teary eyes.

110.description: If one of the twin KOFFING inflates, the other one deflates. It con­ stantly mixes its poisonous gases.

111.description: It is inept at turning because of its four short legs. It can only charge and run in one direction.

112.description: Its rugged hide protects it from even the heat of lava. However, the hide also makes it insensitive.

113.description: It walks carefully to prevent its egg from breaking. However, it is extremely fast at running away.

114.description: The vines that cloak its entire body are always jiggling. They effectively un­ nerve its foes.

115.description: If it is safe, the young gets out of the belly pouch to play. The adult keeps a close eye on the youngster.

116.description: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its dorsal fin.

117.description: An examination of its cells revealed the presence of a gene not found in HORSEA. It became a hot topic.

118.description: Its dorsal, pecto­ ral and tail fins wave elegantly in water. That is why it is known as the water dancer.

119.description: During spawning season, SEAKING gather from all over, coloring the rivers a brilliant red.

120.description: At night, the cen­ ter of its body slowly flickers with the same rhythm as a human heartbeat.

121.description: The center section of its body is called the core. It glows in a dif­ ferent color each time it is seen.

122.description: A skilled mime from birth, it gains the ability to create invisi­ ble objects as it matures.

123.description: It slashes through grass with its sharp scythes, moving too fast for the human eye to track.

124.description: It rocks its body rhythmically. It appears to alter the rhythm depend­ ing on how it is feeling.

125.description: Electricity runs across the surface of its body. In darkness, its en­ tire body glows a whitish-blue.

126.description: It dislikes cold places, so it blows scorching flames to make the environment suit­ able for itself.

127.description: With its horns, it digs burrows to sleep in at night. In the morning, damp soil clings to its body.

128.description: They fight each other by locking horns. The herd's protector takes pride in its bat­ tle-scarred horns.

129.description: An underpowered, pathetic POKéMON. It may jump high on rare occasions, but never more than seven feet.

130.description: They say that during past wars, GYARADOS would appear and leave blazing ruins in its wake.

131.description: They have gentle hearts. Because they rarely fight, many have been caught. Their num­ ber has dwindled.

132.description: It can transform into anything. When it sleeps, it changes into a stone to avoid being attacked.

133.description: It has the ability to alter the com­ position of its body to suit its surrounding envi­ ronment.

134.description: When VAPOREON's fins begin to vi­ brate, it is a sign that rain will come within a few hours.

135.description: It concentrates the weak electric charges emitted by its cells and launches wicked lightning bolts.

136.description: It stores some of the air it inhales in its internal flame pouch, which heats it to over 3,000 degrees.

137.description: It is a manmade POKéMON. Since it doesn't breathe, people are eager to try it in any environment.

138.description: Revived from an ancient fossil, this POKéMON uses air stored in its shell to sink and rise in water.

139.description: Apparently, it cracked SHELLDER's shell with its sharp fangs and sucked out the insides.

140.description: On rare occasions, some have been found as fossils which they became while hiding on the ocean floor.

141.description: In the water, it tucks in its limbs to become more compact, then it wiggles its shell to swim fast.

142.description: A vicious POKéMON from the distant past, it appears to have flown by spreading its wings and gliding.

143.description: What sounds like its cry may ac­ tually be its snores or the rumblings of its hungry belly.

144.description: The magnificent, seemingly translu­ cent wings of this legendary bird POKéMON are said to be made of ice.

145.description: This legendary bird POKéMON causes savage thunderstorms by flapping its glit­ tering wings.

146.description: This legendary POKéMON scatters embers with every flap of its wings. It is a thrilling sight to behold.

147.description: It is born large to start with. It repeatedly sheds its skin as it steadily grows longer.

148.description: They say that if it emits an aura from its whole body, the weather will begin to change instantly.

149.description: It is said that this POKéMON con­ stantly flies over the immense seas and rescues drown­ ing people.

150.description: Because its battle abilities were raised to the ultimate level, it thinks only of de­ feating its foes.

151.description: Apparently, it appears only to those people who are pure of heart and have a strong desire to see it.

152.description: A sweet aroma gently wafts from the leaf on its head. It is docile and loves to soak up the sun's rays.

153.description: The scent of spices comes from around its neck. Somehow, sniffing it makes you want to fight.

154.description: The aroma that rises from its petals contains a substance that calms aggressive feelings.

155.description: It is timid, and always curls it­ self up in a ball. If attacked, it flares up its back for protection.

156.description: Be careful if it turns its back during battle. It means that it will attack with the fire on its back.

157.description: If its rage peaks, it becomes so hot that anything that touches it will instantly go up in flames.

158.description: Its well-developed jaws are powerful and capable of crushing anything. Even its trainer must be careful.

159.description: If it loses a fang, a new one grows back in its place. There are always 48 fangs lining its mouth.

160.description: When it bites with its massive and powerful jaws, it shakes its head and savagely tears its victim up.

161.description: A very cautious POKéMON, it raises itself up using its tail to get a better view of its surroundings.

162.description: It makes a nest to suit its long and skinny body. The nest is impossible for other POKéMON to enter.

163.description: It always stands on one foot. It changes feet so fast, the movement can rarely be seen.

164.description: Its eyes are specially adapted. They concentrate even faint light and enable it to see in the dark.

165.description: It is very timid. It will be afraid to move if it is alone. But it will be active if it is in a group.

166.description: When the stars flicker in the night sky, it flutters about, scattering a glowing powder.

167.description: It lies still in the same pose for days in its web, waiting for its unsuspecting prey to wander close.

168.description: It spins string not only from its rear but also from its mouth. It is hard to tell which end is which.

169.description: It flies so si­ lently through the dark on its four wings that it may not be noticed even when nearby.

170.description: It shoots positive and negative elec­ tricity between the tips of its two antennae and zaps its enemies.

171.description: The light it emits is so bright that it can illuminate the sea's surface from a depth of over three miles.

172.description: It is not yet skilled at storing electricity. It may send out a jolt if amused or startled.

173.description: Because of its unusual, star-like silhouette, people believe that it came here on a meteor.

174.description: It has a very soft body. If it starts to roll, it will bounce all over and be impossible to stop.

175.description: The shell seems to be filled with joy. It is said that it will share good luck when treated kindly.

176.description: They say that it will appear before kindhearted, car­ ing people and shower them with happiness.

177.description: Because its wings aren't yet fully grown, it has to hop to get around. It is always star­ ing at something.

178.description: They say that it stays still and quiet because it is seeing both the past and future at the same time.

179.description: If static elec­ tricity builds in its body, its fleece doubles in volume. Touching it will shock you.

180.description: As a result of storing too much electricity, it developed patches where even downy wool won't grow.

181.description: The tail's tip shines brightly and can be seen from far away. It acts as a beacon for lost people.

182.description: BELLOSSOM gather at times and appear to dance. They say that the dance is a ritual to summon the sun.

183.description: The tip of its tail, which con­ tains oil that is lighter than wa­ ter, lets it swim without drowning.

184.description: By keeping still and listening in­ tently, it can tell what is in even wild, fast- moving rivers.

185.description: Although it always pretends to be a tree, its composi­ tion appears to be closer to a rock than a plant.

186.description: If POLIWAG and POLIWHIRL hear its echoing cry, they respond by gather­ ing from far and wide.

187.description: To keep from being blown away by the wind, they gather in clusters. They do enjoy gentle breezes, though.

188.description: The bloom on top of its head opens and closes as the temperature fluc­ tuates up and down.

189.description: Once it catches the wind, it deft­ ly controls its cotton-puff spores to float, even around the world.

190.description: Its tail is so powerful that it can use it to grab a tree branch and hold itself up in the air.

191.description: It may drop out of the sky suddenly. If attacked by a SPEAROW, it will violently shake its leaves.

192.description: It converts sun­ light into energy. In the darkness after sunset, it closes its petals and becomes still.

193.description: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter win­ dows in the area.

194.description: This POKéMON lives in cold water. It will leave the water to search for food when it gets cold outside.

195.description: This carefree POKéMON has an easy-going nature. While swimming, it always bumps into boat hulls.

196.description: It uses the fine hair that covers its body to sense air currents and predict its ene­ my's actions.

197.description: When agitated, this POKéMON pro­ tects itself by spraying poisonous sweat from its pores.

198.description: Feared and loathed by many, it is believed to bring misfortune to all those who see it at night.

199.description: It has incredible intellect and in­ tuition. Whatever the situation, it remains calm and collected.

200.description: It likes playing mischievous tricks such as screaming and wailing to startle people at night.

201.description: Their shapes look like hieroglyphs on ancient tab­ lets. It is said that the two are somehow related.

202.description: It hates light and shock. If attack­ ed, it inflates its body to pump up its counter­ strike.

203.description: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent and bite.

204.description: It likes to make its shell thicker by adding layers of tree bark. The additional weight doesn't bother it.

205.description: Its entire body is shielded by a steel-hard shell. What lurks inside the armor is a total mystery.

206.description: When spotted, this POKéMON escapes backward by furi­ ously boring into the ground with its tail.

207.description: It flies straight at its target's face then clamps down on the star­ tled victim to inject poison.

208.description: Its body has been compressed deep under the ground. As a result, it is even harder than a diamond.

209.description: Although it looks frightening, it is actually kind and affectionate. It is very popular among women.

210.description: It is actually timid and easily spooked. If at­ tacked, it flails about to fend off its attacker.

211.description: To fire its poison spikes, it must inflate its body by drinking over 2.6 gallons of water all at once.

212.description: It swings its eye- patterned pincers up to scare its foes. This makes it look like it has three heads.

213.description: The BERRIES it stores in its vase-like shell decompose and become a gooey liquid.

214.description: This powerful POKéMON thrusts its prized horn under its enemies’ bellies then lifts and throws them.

215.description: Its paws conceal sharp claws. If attacked, it sud­ denly extends the claws and startles its enemy.

216.description: If it finds honey, its crescent mark glows. It always licks its paws because they are soaked with honey.

217.description: Although it is a good climber, it prefers to snap trees with its forelegs and eat fallen BERRIES.

218.description: It never sleeps. It has to keep moving because if it stopped, its magma body would cool and harden.

219.description: The shell on its back is just skin that has cooled and hardened. It breaks easily with a slight touch.

220.description: It rubs its snout on the ground to find and dig up food. It sometimes discovers hot springs.

221.description: Because the long hair all over its body obscures its sight, it just keeps charging repeatedly.

222.description: It continuously sheds and grows. The tip of its head is prized as a treasure for its beauty.

223.description: It has superb ac­ curacy. The water it shoots out can strike even moving prey from more than 300 feet.

224.description: It traps enemies with its suction- cupped tentacles then smashes them with its rock-hard head.

225.description: It carries food all day long. There are tales about lost people who were saved by the food it had.

226.description: As it majestically swims, it doesn't care if REMORAID attach to it for scavenging its leftovers.

227.description: Its sturdy wings look heavy, but they are actually hollow and light, allowing it to fly freely in the sky.

228.description: It uses different kinds of cries for communicating with others of its kind and for pursuing its prey.

229.description: If you are burned by the flames it shoots from its mouth, the pain will never go away.

230.description: It is said that it usually hides in underwater caves. It can create whirlpools by yawning.

231.description: It swings its long snout around play­ fully, but because it is so strong, that can be dan­ gerous.

232.description: It has sharp, hard tusks and a rugged hide. Its TACKLE is strong enough to knock down a house.

233.description: This upgraded version of PORYGON is designed for space exploration. It can't fly, though.

234.description: The curved antlers subtly change the flow of air to create a strange space where real­ ity is distorted.

235.description: A special fluid oozes from the tip of its tail. It paints the fluid everywhere to mark its territory.

236.description: It is always bursting with en­ ergy. To make it­ self stronger, it keeps on fighting even if it loses.

237.description: If you become enchanted by its smooth, elegant, dance-like kicks, you may get drilled hard.

238.description: Its lips are the most sensitive parts on its body. It always uses its lips first to examine things.

239.description: It rotates its arms to generate electricity, but it tires easily, so it charges up only a little bit.

240.description: Each and every time it inhales and exhales, hot embers dribble out of its mouth and nostrils.

241.description: Its milk is packed with nutrition, making it the ultimate beverage for the sick or weary.

242.description: Anyone who takes even one bite of BLISSEY's egg be­ comes unfailingly caring and pleas­ ant to everyone.

243.description: The rain clouds it carries let it fire thunderbolts at will. They say that it descended with lightning.

244.description: Volcanoes erupt when it barks. Un­ able to restrain its extreme power, it races headlong around the land.

245.description: Said to be the reincarnation of north winds, it can instantly purify filthy, murky water.

246.description: It feeds on soil. After it has eaten a large mountain, it will fall asleep so it can grow.

247.description: Its shell is as hard as sheet rock, and it is also very strong. Its THRASHING can topple a mountain.

248.description: Its body can't be harmed by any sort of attack, so it is very eager to make challenges against enemies.

249.description: It is said that it quietly spends its time deep at the bottom of the sea because its powers are too strong.

250.description: Legends claim this POKéMON flies the world's skies con­ tinuously on its magnificent seven- colored wings.

251.description: This POKéMON wan­ ders across time. Grass and trees flourish in the forests in which it has appeared.

252.description: TREECKO has small hooks on the bottom of its feet that enable it to scale vertical walls. This POKéMON attacks by slamming foes with its thick tail.

253.description: The leaves growing out of GROVYLE’s body are convenient for camouflaging it from enemies in the forest. This POKéMON is a master at climbing trees in jungles.

254.description: The leaves growing on SCEPTILE’s body are very sharp edged. This POKéMON is very agile - it leaps all over the branches of trees and jumps on its foe from above or behind.

255.description: TORCHIC sticks with its TRAINER, following behind with unsteady steps. This POKéMON breathes fire of over 1,800 degrees F, including fireballs that leave the foe scorched black.

256.description: COMBUSKEN toughens up its legs and thighs by running through fields and mountains. This POKéMON’s legs possess both speed and power, enabling it to dole out ten kicks in one second.

257.description: In battle, BLAZIKEN blows out intense flames from its wrists and attacks foes courageously. The stronger the foe, the more intensely this POKéMON’s wrists burn.

258.description: The fin on MUDKIP’s head acts as highly sensitive radar. Using this fin to sense movements of water and air, this POKéMON can determine what is taking place around it without using its eyes.

259.description: The surface of MARSHTOMP’s body is enveloped by a thin, sticky film that enables it to live on land. This POKéMON plays in mud on beaches when the ocean tide is low.

260.description: SWAMPERT is very strong. It has enough power to easily drag a boulder weighing more than a ton. This POKéMON also has powerful vision that lets it see even in murky water.

261.description: At first sight, POOCHYENA takes a bite at anything that moves. This POKéMON chases after prey until the victim becomes exhausted. However, it may turn tail if the prey strikes back.

262.description: MIGHTYENA gives obvious signals when it is preparing to attack. It starts to growl deeply and then flattens its body. This POKéMON will bite savagely with its sharply pointed fangs.

263.description: ZIGZAGOON restlessly wanders everywhere at all times. This POKéMON does so because it is very curious. It becomes interested in anything that it happens to see.

264.description: LINOONE always runs full speed and only in straight lines. If facing an obstacle, it makes a right-angle turn to evade it. This POKéMON is very challenged by gently curving roads.

265.description: Using the spikes on its rear end,   WURMPLE peels the bark off trees and feeds on the sap that oozes out. This POKéMON’s feet are tipped with suction pads that allow it to cling to glass without slipping.

266.description: SILCOON tethers itself to a tree branch using silk to keep from falling. There,  this POKéMON hangs quietly while it awaits evolution. It peers out of the silk cocoon through a small hole.

267.description: BEAUTIFLY’s favorite food is the sweet pollen of flowers. If you want to see this POKéMON, just leave a potted flower by an open window. BEAUTIFLY is sure to come looking for pollen.

268.description: CASCOON makes its protective cocoon by wrapping its body entirely with a fine silk from its mouth. Once the silk goes around its body, it hardens. This POKéMON prepares for its evolution inside the cocoon.

269.description: DUSTOX is instinctively drawn to light. Swarms of this POKéMON are attracted by the bright lights of cities, where they wreak havoc by stripping the leaves off roadside trees for food.

270.description: It searches about for clean water. If it does not drink water for too long, the leaf on its head wilts.

271.description: It lives at the water’s edge where it is sunny. It sleeps on a bed of water grass by day and becomes active at night.

272.description: LUDICOLO begins dancing as soon as it hears cheerful, festive music. This POKéMON is said to appear when it hears the singing of children on hiking outings.

273.description: SEEDOT attaches itself to a tree branch using the top of its head. It sucks moisture from the tree while hanging off the branch. The more water it drinks, the glossier this POKéMON’s body becomes.

274.description: NUZLEAF live in densely overgrown forests. They occasionally venture out of the forest to startle people. This POKéMON dislikes having its long nose pinched.

275.description: It lives quietly in the deep forest. It is said to create chilly winter winds with the fans it holds.

276.description: TAILLOW courageously stands its ground against foes, however strong they may be. This gutsy POKéMON will remain defiant even after a loss. On the other hand, it cries loudly if it becomes hungry.

277.description: SWELLOW flies high above our heads, making graceful arcs in the sky. This POKéMON dives at a steep angle as soon as it spots its prey. The hapless prey is tightly grasped by SWELLOW’s clawed feet, preventing escape.

278.description: WINGULL has the habit of carrying prey and valuables in its beak and hiding them in all sorts of locations. This POKéMON rides the winds and flies as if it were skating across the sky.

279.description: It is a messenger of the skies, carrying small Pokémon and eggs to safety in its bill.

280.description: RALTS senses the emotions of people using the horns on its head. This POKéMON rarely appears before people. But when it does, it draws closer if it senses that the person has a positive disposition.

281.description: It is said that a KIRLIA that is exposed to the positive emotions of its TRAINER grows beautiful. This POKéMON controls psychokinetic powers with its highly developed brain.

282.description: GARDEVOIR has the ability to read the future. If it senses impending danger to its TRAINER, this POKéMON is said to unleash its psychokinetic energy at full power.

283.description: From the tips of its feet, SURSKIT secretes an oil that enables it to walk on water as if it were skating. This POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms in ponds and lakes.

284.description: MASQUERAIN intimidates enemies with the eyelike patterns on its antennas. This POKéMON flaps its four wings to freely fly in any direction - even sideways and backwards - as if it were a helicopter.

285.description: SHROOMISH live in damp soil in the dark depths of forests. They are often found keeping still under fallen leaves. This POKéMON feeds on compost that is made up of fallen, rotted leaves.

286.description: BRELOOM closes in on its foe with light and sprightly footwork, then throws punches with its stretchy arms. This POKéMON’s fighting technique puts boxers to shame.

287.description: SLAKOTH lolls around for over twenty hours every day. Because it moves so little, it does not need much food. This POKéMON’s sole daily meal consists of just three leaves.

288.description: VIGOROTH is always itching and agitated to go on a wild rampage. It simply can’t tolerate sitting still for even a minute. This POKéMON’s stress level rises if it can’t be moving constantly.

289.description: SLAKING spends all day lying down and lolling about. It eats grass growing within its reach. If it eats all the grass it can reach, this POKéMON reluctantly moves to another spot.

290.description: NINCADA lives underground for many years in complete darkness. This POKéMON absorbs nutrients from the roots of trees. It stays motionless as it waits for evolution.

291.description: NINJASK moves around at such a high speed that it cannot be seen, even while its crying can be clearly heard. For that reason, this POKéMON was long believed to be invisible.

292.description: SHEDINJA’s hard body doesn’t move - not even a twitch. In fact, its body appears to be merely a hollow shell. It is believed that this POKéMON will steal the spirit of anyone peering into its hollow body from its back.

293.description: Normally, WHISMUR’s voice is very quiet - it is barely audible even if one is paying close attention. However, if this POKéMON senses danger, it starts crying at an earsplitting volume.

294.description: LOUDRED’s bellowing can completely decimate a wood-frame house. It uses its voice to punish its foes. This POKéMON’s round ears serve as loudspeakers.

295.description: EXPLOUD triggers earthquakes with the tremors it creates by bellowing. If this POKéMON violently inhales from the ports on its body, it’s a sign that it is preparing to let loose a huge bellow.

296.description: MAKUHITA is tenacious - it will keep getting up and attacking its foe however many times it is knocked down. Every time it gets back up, this POKéMON stores more energy in its body for evolving.

297.description: It has the habit of challenging others without hesitation to tests of strength. It’s been known to stand on train tracks and stop trains using forearm thrusts.

298.description: A Pokémon that lives by water. It moves quickly on land by bouncing on its big tail.

299.description: NOSEPASS’s magnetic nose is always pointed to the north. If two of these POKéMON meet, they cannot turn their faces to each other when they are close because their magnetic noses repel one another.

300.description: SKITTY has the habit of becoming fascinated by moving objects and chasing them around. This POKéMON is known to chase after its own tail and become dizzy.

301.description: DELCATTY prefers to live an unfettered existence in which it can do as it pleases at its own pace. Because this POKéMON eats and sleeps whenever it decides, its daily routines are completely random.

302.description: SABLEYE lead quiet lives deep inside caverns. They are feared, however, because these POKéMON are thought to steal the spirits of people when their eyes burn with a sinister glow in the darkness.

303.description: MAWHILE’s huge jaws are actually steel horns that have been transformed. Its docile-looking face serves to lull its foe into letting down its guard. When the foe least expects it, MAWHILE chomps it with its gaping jaws.

304.description: This POKéMON has a body of steel. To make its body, ARON feeds on iron ore that it digs from mountains. Occasionally, it causes major trouble by eating bridges and rails.

305.description: LAIRON tempers its steel body by drinking highly nutritious mineral springwater until it is bloated. This POKéMON makes its nest close to springs of delicious water.

306.description: AGGRON claims an entire mountain as its own territory. It mercilessly beats up anything that violates its environment. This POKéMON vigilantly patrols its territory at all times.

307.description: MEDITITE undertakes rigorous mental training deep in the mountains. However, whenever it meditates, this POKéMON always loses its concentration and focus. As a result, its training never ends.

308.description: It is said that through meditation, MEDICHAM heightens energy inside its body and sharpens its sixth sense. This POKéMON hides its presence by merging itself with fields and mountains.

309.description: ELECTRIKE stores electricity in its long body hair. This POKéMON stimulates its leg muscles with electric charges. These jolts of power give its legs explosive acceleration performance.

310.description: MANECTRIC is constantly discharging electricity from its mane. The sparks sometimes ignite forest fires. When it enters a battle, this POKéMON creates thunderclouds.

311.description: PLUSLE always acts as a cheerleader for its partners. Whenever a teammate puts out a good effort in battle, this POKéMON shorts out its body to create the crackling noises of sparks to show its joy.

312.description: MINUN is more concerned about cheering on its partners than its own safety. It shorts out the electricity in its body to create brilliant showers of sparks to cheer on its teammates.

313.description: With the arrival of night, VOLBEAT emits light from its tail. It communicates with others by adjusting the intensity and flashing of its light. This POKéMON is attracted by the sweet aroma of ILLUMISE.

314.description: With its sweet aroma, it guides Volbeat to draw signs with light in the night sky.

315.description: ROSELIA shoots sharp thorns as projectiles at any opponent that tries to steal the flowers on its arms. The aroma of this POKéMON brings serenity to living things.

316.description: Virtually all of GULPIN’s body is its stomach. As a result, it can swallow something its own size. This POKéMON’s stomach contains a special fluid that digests anything.

317.description: When SWALOT spots prey, it spurts out a hideously toxic fluid from its pores and sprays the target. Once the prey has weakened, this POKéMON gulps it down whole with its cavernous mouth.

318.description: CARVANHA’s strongly developed jaws and its sharply pointed fangs pack the destructive power to rip out boat hulls. Many boats have been attacked and sunk by this POKéMON.

319.description: Nicknamed “the bully of the sea,” SHARPEDO is widely feared. Its cruel fangs grow back immediately if they snap off. Just one of these POKéMON can thoroughly tear apart a supertanker.

320.description: WAILMER’s nostrils are located above its eyes. This playful POKéMON loves to startle people by forcefully snorting out seawater it stores inside its body out of its nostrils.

321.description: WAILORD is the largest of all identified POKéMON up to now. This giant POKéMON swims languorously in the vast open sea, eating massive amounts of food at once with its enormous mouth.

322.description: NUMEL is extremely dull witted - it doesn’t notice being hit. However, it can’t stand hunger for even a second. This POKéMON’s body is a seething cauldron of boiling magma.

323.description: CAMERUPT has a volcano inside its body. Magma of 18,000 degrees F courses through its body. Occasionally, the humps on this POKéMON’s back erupt, spewing the superheated magma.

324.description: You can tell how it’s feeling by the smoke spouting from its shell. Tremendous velocity is a sign of good health.

325.description: SPOINK bounces around on its tail. The shock of its bouncing makes its heart pump. As a result, this POKéMON cannot afford to stop bouncing - if it stops, its heart will stop.

326.description: GRUMPIG uses the black pearls on its body to amplify its psychic power waves for gaining total control over its foe. When this POKéMON uses its special power, its snorting breath grows labored.

327.description: No two Spinda have the same pattern of spots. Its tottering step fouls the aim of foes.

328.description: TRAPINCH’s nest is a sloped, bowl-like pit dug in sand. This POKéMON patiently waits for prey to tumble down the pit. Its giant jaws have enough strength to crush even boulders.

329.description: To make prey faint, VIBRAVA generates ultrasonic waves by vigorously making its two wings vibrate. This POKéMON’s ultrasonic waves are so powerful, they can bring on headaches in people.

330.description: FLYGON is nicknamed “the elemental  spirit of the desert.” Because its flapping wings whip up a cloud of sand, this POKéMON is always enveloped in a sandstorm while flying.

331.description: CACNEA lives in arid locations such as deserts. It releases a strong aroma from its flower to attract prey. When prey comes near, this POKéMON shoots sharp thorns from its body to bring the victim down.

332.description: During the daytime, CACTURNE remains unmoving so that it does not lose any moisture to the harsh desert sun. This POKéMON becomes active at night when the temperature drops.

333.description: SWABLU has light and fluffy wings that are like cottony clouds. This POKéMON is not frightened of people. It lands on the heads of people and sits there like a cotton-fluff hat.

334.description: ALTARIA dances and wheels through the sky among billowing, cotton-like clouds. By singing melodies in its crystal-clear voice, this POKéMON makes its listeners experience dreamy wonderment.

335.description: Memories of battling its arch-rival SEVIPER are etched into every cell of ZANGOOSE’s body. This POKéMON adroitly dodges attacks with incredible agility.

336.description: SEVIPER shares a generations-long feud with ZANGOOSE. The scars on its body are evidence of vicious battles. This POKéMON attacks using its sword- edged tail.

337.description: LUNATONE was discovered at a location where a meteorite fell. As a result, some people theorize that this POKéMON came from space. However, no one has been able to prove this theory so far.

338.description: Solar energy is the source of its power, so it is strong during the daytime. When it spins, its body shines.

339.description: BARBOACH’s sensitive whiskers serve as a superb radar system. This POKéMON hides in mud, leaving only its two whiskers exposed while it waits for prey to come along.

340.description: WHISCASH is extremely territorial. Just one of these POKéMON will claim a large pond as its exclusive territory. If a foe approaches it, it thrashes about and triggers a massive earthquake.

341.description: Its hardy vitality enables it to adapt to any environment. Its pincers will never release prey.

342.description: CRAWDAUNT has an extremely violent nature that compels it to challenge other living things to battle. Other life-forms refuse to live in ponds inhabited by this POKéMON, making them desolate places.

343.description: BALTOY moves while spinning around on its one foot. Primitive wall paintings depicting this POKéMON living among people were discovered in some ancient ruins.

344.description: CLAYDOL are said to be dolls of mud made by primitive humans and brought to life by exposure to a mysterious ray. This POKéMON moves about while levitating.

345.description: LILEEP became extinct approximately a hundred million years ago. This ancient POKéMON attaches itself to a rock on the seafloor and catches approaching prey using tentacles  shaped like flower petals.

346.description: CRADILY roams around the ocean floor in search of food. This POKéMON freely extends its tree trunk-like neck and captures unwary prey using its eight tentacles.

347.description: ANORITH was regenerated from a prehistoric fossil. This primitive POKéMON once lived in warm seas. It grips its prey firmly between its two large claws.

348.description: ARMALDO’s tough armor makes all attacks bounce off. This POKéMON’s two enormous claws can be freely extended or contracted. They have the power to punch right through a steel slab.

349.description: FEEBAS’s fins are ragged and tattered from the start of its life. Because of its shoddy appearance, this POKéMON is largely ignored. It is capable of living in both the sea and in rivers.

350.description: Its lovely scales are described as rainbow colored. They change color depending on the viewing angle.

351.description: CASTFORM’s appearance changes with the weather. This POKéMON gained the ability to use the vast power of nature to protect its tiny body.

352.description: It changes body color to blend in with its surroundings. It also changes color if it is happy or sad.

353.description: SHUPPET is attracted by feelings of jealousy and vindictiveness. If someone develops strong feelings of vengeance, this POKéMON will appear in a swarm and line up beneath the eaves of that person’s home.

354.description: BANETTE generates energy for laying strong curses by sticking pins into its own body. This POKéMON was originally a pitiful plush doll that was thrown away.

355.description: DUSKULL can pass through any wall no matter how thick it may be. Once this POKéMON chooses a target, it will doggedly pursue the intended victim until the break of dawn.

356.description: DUSCLOPS’s body is completely hollow - there is nothing at all inside. It is said that its body is like a black hole. This POKéMON will absorb anything into its body, but nothing will ever come back out.

357.description: The bunches of fruit around TROPIUS’s neck are very popular with children. This POKéMON loves fruit, and eats it continuously. Apparently, its love for fruit resulted in its own outgrowth of fruit.

358.description: CHIMECHO makes its cries echo inside its hollow body. When this POKéMON becomes enraged, its cries result in ultrasonic waves that have the power to knock foes flying.

359.description: Every time ABSOL appears before people, it is followed by a disaster such as an earthquake or a tidal wave. As a result, it came to be known as the disaster POKéMON.

360.description: WYNAUT can always be seen with a big, happy smile on its face. Look at its tail to determine if it is angry. When angered, this POKéMON will be slapping the ground with its tail.

361.description: SNORUNT live in regions with heavy snowfall. In seasons without snow, such as spring and summer, this POKéMON steals away to live quietly among stalactites and stalagmites deep in caverns.

362.description: GLALIE has a body made of rock, which it hardens with an armor of ice. This POKéMON has the ability to freeze moisture in the atmosphere into any shape it desires.

363.description: SPHEAL is much faster rolling than  walking to get around. When groups of this POKéMON eat, they all clap at once to show their pleasure. Because of this, their mealtimes are noisy.

364.description: SEALEO has the habit of always juggling on the tip of its nose anything it sees for the first time. This POKéMON occasionally entertains itself by balancing and rolling a SPHEAL on its nose.

365.description: It swims through icy seas while shattering ice floes with its large tusks. It is protected by its thick blubber.

366.description: CLAMPERL’s sturdy shell is not only good for protection - it is also used for clamping and catching prey. A fully grown CLAMPERL’s shell will be scored with nicks and scratches all over.

367.description: HUNTAIL’s presence went unnoticed by people for a long time because it lives at extreme depths in the sea. This POKéMON’s eyes can see clearly even in the murky dark depths of the ocean.

368.description: GOREBYSS lives in the southern seas at extreme depths. Its body is built to withstand the enormous pressure of water at incredible depths. Because of this, this POKéMON’s body is unharmed by ordinary attacks.

369.description: RELICANTH is a POKéMON species that existed for a hundred million years without ever changing its form. This ancient POKéMON feeds on microscopic organisms with its toothless mouth.

370.description: LUVDISC live in shallow seas in the tropics. This heart-shaped POKéMON earned its name by swimming after loving couples it spotted in the ocean’s waves.

371.description: Dreaming of one day flying, it practices by leaping off cliffs every day.

372.description: Inside SHELGON’s armor-like shell, cells are in the midst of transformation to create an entirely new body. This POKéMON’s shell is extremely heavy, making its movements sluggish.

373.description: SALAMENCE came about as a result of a strong, long-held dream of growing wings. It is said that this powerful desire triggered a sudden mutation in this POKéMON’s cells, causing it to sprout its magnificent wings.

374.description: Instead of blood, a powerful magnetic force courses throughout BELDUM’s body. This POKéMON communicates with others by sending controlled pulses of magnetism.

375.description: When two BELDUM fuse together, METANG is formed. The brains of the BELDUM are joined by a magnetic nervous system. By linking its brains magnetically, this POKéMON generates strong psychokinetic power.

376.description: METAGROSS has four brains in total. Combined, the four brains can breeze through difficult calculations faster than a supercomputer. This POKéMON can float in the air by tucking in its four legs.

377.description: Its entire body is made of rock. If any part chips off in battle, it attaches rocks to repair itself.

378.description: REGICE’s body was made during an ice age. The deep-frozen body can’t be melted, even by fire. This POKéMON controls frigid air of minus 328 degrees F.

379.description: REGISTEEL has a body that is harder than any kind of metal. Its body is apparently hollow. No one has any idea what this POKéMON eats.

380.description: LATIAS is highly sensitive to the emotions of people. If it senses any hostility, this POKéMON ruffles the feathers all over its body and cries shrilly to intimidate the foe.

381.description: LATIOS has the ability to make its foe see an image of what it has seen or imagines in its head. This POKéMON is intelligent and understands human speech.

382.description: KYOGRE has the power to create massive rain clouds that cover the entire sky and bring about torrential downpours. This POKéMON saved people who were suffering from droughts.

383.description: GROUDON has long been described in  mythology as the POKéMON that raised lands and expanded continents. This POKéMON took to sleep after a cataclysmic battle with KYOGRE.

384.description: RAYQUAZA lived for hundreds of millions of years in the earth’s ozone layer,  never descending to the ground. This POKéMON appears to feed on water and particles in the atmosphere.

385.description: A legend states that JIRACHI will make true any wish that is written on notes attached to its head when it awakens. If this POKéMON senses danger, it will fight without awakening.

386.description: The DNA of a space virus underwent a sudden mutation upon exposure to a laser beam and resulted in DEOXYS. The crystalline organ on this POKéMON’s chest appears to be its brain.

387.description: Made from soil, the shell on its back hardens when it drinks water. It lives along lakes.

388.description: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

389.description: Small Pokémon occasionally gather on its unmoving back to begin building their nests.

390.description: It agilely scales sheer cliffs to live atop craggy mountains. Its fire is put out when it sleeps.

391.description: To intimidate attackers, it stretches the fire on its tail to make itself appear bigger.

392.description: It uses a special kind of martial arts involving all its limbs. Its fire never goes out.

393.description: Because it is very proud, it hates accepting food from people. Its thick down guards it from cold.

394.description: It lives alone, away from others. Apparently, every one of them believes it is the most important.

395.description: The three horns that extend from its beak attest to its power. The leader has the biggest horns.

396.description: They flock in great numbers. Though small, they flap their wings with great power.

397.description: It flies around forests and fields in search of bug Pokémon. It stays within a huge flock.

398.description: It has a savage nature. It will courageously challenge foes that are much larger.

399.description: With nerves of steel, nothing can perturb it. It is more agile and active than it appears.

400.description: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

401.description: It shakes its head back to front, causing its antennae to hit each other and sound like a xylophone.

402.description: It crosses its knifelike arms in front of its chest when it cries. It can compose melodies ad lib.

403.description: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

404.description: Its claws loose electricity with enough amperage to cause fainting. They live in small groups.

405.description: It has eyes that can see through anything. It spots and captures prey hiding behind objects.

406.description: Over the winter, it closes its bud and endures the cold. In spring, the bud opens and releases pollen.

407.description: It attracts prey with a sweet aroma, then downs it with thorny whips hidden in its arms.

408.description: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.

409.description: Its powerful head butt has enough power to shatter even the most durable things upon impact.

410.description: A Pokémon that lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its facial hide is extremely hard.

411.description: Any frontal attack is repulsed. It is a docile Pokémon that feeds on grass and berries.

412.description: To shelter itself from cold, wintry winds, it covers itself with a cloak made of twigs and leaves.

413.description: When BURMY evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.

414.description: It loves the honey of flowers and steals honey collected by COMBEE.

415.description: A Pokémon formed by three others. It busily carries sweet floral honey to VESPIQUEN.

416.description: Its abdomen is a honeycomb for grubs. It raises its grubs on honey collected by COMBEE.

417.description: It makes fur balls that crackle with static electricity. It stores them with berries in tree holes.

418.description: It has a flotation sac that is like an inflatable collar. It floats on water with its head out.

419.description: It floats using its well-developed flotation sac. It assists in the rescues of drowning people.

420.description: The small ball holds the nutrients needed for evolution. Apparently, it is very sweet and tasty.

421.description: It blooms during times of strong sunlight. It tries to make up for everything it endured as a bud.

422.description: Its colors and shapes differ from region to region. In the Sinnoh region, two types are confirmed.

423.description: It has a pliable body without any bones. If any part of its body is torn off, it grows right back.

424.description: To eat, it deftly shucks nuts with its two tails. It rarely uses its arms now.

425.description: A Pokémon formed by the spirits of people and Pokémon. It loves damp, humid seasons.

426.description: At dusk, swarms of them are carried aloft on winds. When noticed, they suddenly vanish.

427.description: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.

428.description: An extremely cautious Pokémon. It cloaks its body with its fluffy ear fur when it senses danger.

429.description: Its cries sound like incantations. Those hearing it are tormented by headaches and hallucinations.

430.description: Becoming active at night, it is known to swarm with numerous MURKROW in tow.

431.description: It claws if displeased and purrs when affectionate. Its fickleness is very popular among some.

432.description: It is a brazen brute that barges its way into another Pokémon’s nest and claims it as its own.

433.description: It emits cries by agitating an orb at the back of its throat. It moves with flouncing hops.

434.description: It protects itself by spraying a noxious fluid from its rear. The stench lingers for 24 hours.

435.description: It sprays a vile-smelling fluid from the tip of its tail to attack. Its range is over 160 feet.

436.description: Implements shaped like it were discovered in ancient tombs. It is unknown if they are related.

437.description: One caused a news sensation when it was dug up at a construction site after a 2,000-year sleep.

438.description: It looks as if it is always crying. It is actually adjusting its body’s fluid levels by eliminating excess.

439.description: It habitually mimics foes. Once mimicked, the foe cannot take its eyes off this Pokémon.

440.description: It loves round white things. It carries an egg-shaped rock in imitation of CHANSEY.

441.description: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

442.description: A Pokémon that was formed by 108 spirits. It is bound to a fissure in an odd keystone.

443.description: It nests in small, horizontal holes in cave walls. It pounces to catch prey that stray too close.

444.description: There is a long-held belief that medicine made from its scales will heal even incurable illnesses.

445.description: When it folds up its body and extends its wings, it looks like a jet plane. It flies at sonic speed.

446.description: It wolfs down its weight in food once a day, swallowing food whole with almost no chewing.

447.description: The aura that emanates from its body intensifies to alert others if it is afraid or sad.

448.description: It has the ability to sense the auras of all things. It understands human speech.

449.description: It lives in arid places. Instead of perspiration, it expels grainy sand from its body.

450.description: It blasts internally stored sand from ports on its body to create a towering twister for attack.

451.description: It grips prey with its tail claws and injects poison. It tenaciously hangs on until the poison takes.

452.description: It has the power in its clawed arms to make scrap of a car. The tips of its claws release poison.

453.description: Its cheeks hold poison sacs. It tries to catch foes off guard to jab them with toxic fingers.

454.description: Its knuckle claws secrete a toxin so vile that even a scratch could prove fatal.

455.description: It attracts prey with its sweet- smelling saliva, then chomps down. It takes a whole day to eat prey.

456.description: After long exposure to sunlight, the patterns on its tail fins shine vividly when darkness arrives.

457.description: It lives on the deep-sea floor. It attracts prey by flashing the patterns on its four tail fins.

458.description: A friendly Pokémon that captures the subtle flows of seawater using its two antennae.

459.description: It lives on snowy mountains. Having had little contact with humans, it is boldly inquisitive.

460.description: It whips up blizzards in mountains that are always buried in snow. It is the abominable snowman.

461.description: They live in cold regions, forming groups of four or five that hunt prey with impressive coordination.

462.description: It evolved from exposure to a special magnetic field. Three units generate magnetism.

463.description: It wraps things with its extensible tongue. Getting too close to it will leave you soaked with drool.

464.description: It puts rocks in holes in its palms and uses its muscles to shoot them. GEODUDE are shot at rare times.

465.description: It ensnares prey by extending arms made of vines. Losing arms to predators does not trouble it.

466.description: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

467.description: It blasts fireballs of over 3,600 degrees F from the ends of its arms. It lives in volcanic craters.

468.description: It will never appear where there is strife. Its sightings have become rare recently.

469.description: By churning its wings, it creates shock waves that inflict critical internal injuries to foes.

470.description: Just like a plant, it uses photosynthesis. As a result, it is always enveloped in clear air.

471.description: As a protective technique, it can completely freeze its fur to make its hairs stand like needles.

472.description: It observes prey while hanging inverted from branches. When the chance presents itself, it swoops!

473.description: Its impressive tusks are made of ice. The population thinned when it turned warm after the ice age.

474.description: Additional software was installed to make it a better Pokémon. It began acting oddly, however.

475.description: A master of courtesy and swordsmanship, it fights using extending swords on its elbows.

476.description: It freely controls three small units called Mini-Noses using magnetic force.

477.description: The antenna on its head captures radio waves from the world of spirits that command it to take people there.

478.description: It freezes foes with an icy breath nearly -60 degrees F. What seems to be its body is actually hollow.

479.description: Its body is composed of plasma. It is known to infiltrate electronic devices and wreak havoc.

480.description: Known as “The Being of Knowledge.” It is said that it can wipe out the memory of those who see its eyes.

481.description: Known as “The Being of Emotion.” It taught humans the nobility of sorrow, pain, and joy.

482.description: Known as “The Being of Willpower.” It sleeps at the bottom of a lake to keep the world in balance.

483.description: It has the power to control time. It appears in Sinnoh-region myths as an ancient deity.

484.description: It has the ability to distort space. It is described as a deity in Sinnoh-region mythology.

485.description: It dwells in volcanic caves. It digs in with its cross-shaped feet to crawl on ceilings and walls.

486.description: There is an enduring legend that states this Pokémon towed continents with ropes.

487.description: A Pokémon that is said to live in a world on the reverse side of ours. It appears in an ancient cemetery.

488.description: Shiny particles are released from its wings like a veil. It is said to represent the crescent moon.

489.description: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

490.description: Born on a cold seafloor, it will swim great distances to return to its birthplace.

491.description: It can lull people to sleep and make them dream. It is active during nights of the new moon.

492.description: It lives in flower patches and avoids detection by curling up to look like a flowering plant.

493.description: It is described in mythology as the Pokémon that shaped the universe with its 1,000 arms.

494.description: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

495.description: It is very intelligent and calm. Being exposed to lots of sunlight makes its movements swifter.

496.description: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.

497.description: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.

498.description: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

499.description: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.

500.description: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

501.description: It fights using the scalchop on its stomach. In response to an attack, it retaliates immediately by slashing.

502.description: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.

503.description: One swing of the sword incorporated in its armor can fell an opponent. A simple glare from one of them quiets everybody.

504.description: Using food stored in cheek pouches, they can keep watch for days. They use their tails to communicate with others.

505.description: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.

506.description: It faces strong opponents with great courage. But, when at a disadvantage in a fight, this intelligent Pokémon flees.

507.description: It has black, cape-like fur that is very hard and decreases the amount of damage it receives.

508.description: It rescues people stranded by blizzards in the mountains. Its shaggy fur shields it from the cold.

509.description: They steal from people for fun, but their victims can’t help but forgive them. Their deceptively cute act is perfect.

510.description: These Pokémon vanish and appear unexpectedly. Many Trainers are drawn to their beautiful form and fur.

511.description: This Pokémon dwells deep in the forest. Eating a leaf from its head whisks weariness away as if by magic.

512.description: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.

513.description: When it is angered, the temperature of its head tuft reaches 600° F. It uses its tuft to roast berries.

514.description: It loves sweets because they become energy for the fire burning inside its body.

515.description: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.

516.description: The tuft on its head holds water. When the level runs low, it replenishes the tuft by siphoning up water with its tail.

517.description: Munna always float in the air. People whose dreams are eaten by them forget what the dreams had been about.

518.description: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.

519.description: Each follows its Trainer’s orders as best it can, but they sometimes fail to understand complicated commands.

520.description: It can return to its Trainer’s location regardless of the distance separating them.

521.description: Males swing their head plumage to threaten opponents. The females’ flying abilities surpass those of the males.

522.description: When thunderclouds cover the sky, it will appear. It can catch lightning with its mane and store the electricity.

523.description: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.

524.description: Its ear is hexagonal in shape. Compressed underground, its body is as hard as steel.

525.description: When it overflows with power, the orange crystal on its body glows. It looks for underground water in caves.

526.description: Compressing the energy from its internal core lets it fire off an attack capable of blowing away a mountain.

527.description: Its habitat is dark forests and caves. It emits ultrasonic waves from its nose to learn about its surroundings.

528.description: It emits sound waves of various frequencies from its nose, including some powerful enough to destroy rocks.

529.description: It can dig through the ground at a speed of 30 mph. It could give a car running aboveground a good race.

530.description: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.

531.description: It touches others with the feelers on its ears, using the sound of their heartbeats to tell how they are feeling.

532.description: It fights by swinging a piece of lumber around. It is close to evolving when it can handle the lumber without difficulty.

533.description: This Pokémon is so muscular and strongly built that even a group of wrestlers could not make it budge an inch.

534.description: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.

535.description: They warn others of danger by vibrating their cheeks to create a high-pitched sound.

536.description: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.

537.description: They shoot paralyzing liquid from their head bumps. They use vibration to hurt their opponents.

538.description: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.

539.description: The sound of Sawk punching boulders and trees can be heard all the way from the mountains where they train.

540.description: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

541.description: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

542.description: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

543.description: Its bite injects a potent poison, enough to paralyze large bird Pokémon that try to prey on it.

544.description: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.

545.description: With quick movements, it chases down its foes, attacking relentlessly with its horns until it prevails.

546.description: When attacked, it escapes by shooting cotton from its body. The cotton serves as a decoy to distract the attacker.

547.description: Like the wind, it can slip through any gap, no matter how small. It leaves balls of white fluff behind.

548.description: The leaves on its head are very bitter. Eating one of these leaves is known to refresh a tired body.

549.description: Even veteran Trainers face a challenge in getting its beautiful flower to bloom. This Pokémon is popular with celebrities.

550.description: Red and blue Basculin get along so poorly, they’ll start fighting instantly. These Pokémon are very hostile.

551.description: They live buried in the sands of the desert. The sun-warmed sands prevent their body temperature from dropping.

552.description: They live in groups of a few individuals. Protective membranes shield their eyes from sandstorms.

553.description: They never allow prey to escape. Their jaws are so powerful, they can crush the body of an automobile.

554.description: When its internal fire is burning, it cannot calm down and it runs around. When the fire diminishes, it falls asleep.

555.description: Its internal fire burns at 2,500° F, making enough power that it can destroy a dump truck with one punch.

556.description: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.

557.description: This Pokémon can easily melt holes in hard rocks with a liquid secreted from its mouth.

558.description: Competing for territory, Crustle fight viciously. The one whose boulder is broken is the loser of the battle.

559.description: Its skin has a rubbery elasticity, so it can reduce damage by defensively pulling its skin up to its neck.

560.description: Groups of them beat up anything that enters their territory. Each can spit acidic liquid from its mouth.

561.description: They never vary the route they fly, because their memories of guarding an ancient city remain steadfast.

562.description: Each of them carries a mask that used to be its face when it was human. Sometimes they look at it and cry.

563.description: It has been said that they swallow those who get too close and turn them into mummies. They like to eat gold nuggets.

564.description: Restored from a fossil, this Pokémon can dive to depths beyond half a mile.

565.description: They can live both in the ocean and on land. A slap from one of them is enough to open a hole in the bottom of a tanker.

566.description: Said to be an ancestor of bird Pokémon, they were unable to fly and moved about by hopping from one branch to another.

567.description: They are intelligent and will cooperate to catch prey. From the ground, they use a running start to take flight.

568.description: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

569.description: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

570.description: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

571.description: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

572.description: They greet one another by rubbing each other with their tails, which are always kept well groomed and clean.

573.description: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

574.description: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

575.description: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

576.description: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

577.description: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others.

578.description: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

579.description: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

580.description: These bird Pokémon are excellent divers. They swim around in the water eating their favorite food--peat moss.

581.description: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.

582.description: The temperature of their breath is -58° F. They create snow crystals and make snow fall in the areas around them.

583.description: Snowy mountains are this Pokémon’s habitat. During an ancient ice age, they moved to southern areas.

584.description: Swallowing large amounts of water, they make snow clouds inside their bodies and attack their foes with violent blizzards.

585.description: The color and scent of their fur changes to match the mountain grass. When they sense hostility, they hide in the grass.

586.description: They migrate according to the seasons. People can tell the season by looking at Sawsbuck’s horns.

587.description: The energy made in its cheeks’ electric pouches is stored inside its membrane and released while it is gliding.

588.description: These mysterious Pokémon evolve when they receive electrical stimulation while they are in the same place as Shelmet.

589.description: They fly around at high speed, striking with their pointed spears. Even when in trouble, they face opponents bravely.

590.description: It lures people in with its Poké Ball pattern, then releases poison spores. Why it resembles a Poké Ball is unknown.

591.description: It lures prey close by dancing and waving its arm caps, which resemble Poké Balls, in a swaying motion.

592.description: With its thin, veil-like arms wrapped around the body of its opponent, it sinks to the ocean floor.

593.description: The fate of the ships and crew that wander into Jellicent’s habitat: all sunken, all lost, all vanished.

594.description: The special membrane enveloping Alomomola has the ability to heal wounds.

595.description: Joltik that live in cities have learned a technique for sucking electricity from the outlets in houses.

596.description: When attacked, they create an electric barrier by spitting out many electrically charged threads.

597.description: When threatened, it attacks by shooting a barrage of spikes, which gives it a chance to escape by rolling away.

598.description: It fights by swinging around its three spiky feelers. A hit from these steel spikes can reduce a boulder to rubble.

599.description: The two minigears that mesh together are predetermined. Each will rebound from other minigears without meshing.
